711332f-c.text:
(1)
15th Street, south side, west of Fifth Avenue, with north side in background, showing the children's playground in the rear of the Frederick T. Van Beuren Estate.
August 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another view, a group picture of the children at play.
August 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Another view, with the old New York Hospital in the background. For other views of the Van Beuren house and grounds, see 14th Street.
August 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

711333f-a.text:
New York Hospital, 15th Street adjoining N.W. corner of Fifth Avenue, seen across clearing from 14th Street. This institution is the oldest hospital in New York. It was chartered in 1771 and the cornerstone of the first building laid in 1775. When it was nearly completed, it was destroyed by fire. Work of rebuilding was at once begun, but was interrupted by the outbreak of the Revolution, and the institution did not receive patients until January 1791. In 1869, the original buildings were demolished and work on this building, which was completed in 1877, began. It will be demolished in 1934.

February 12, 1928.

P.L. Sperr.

711331f-a.text:
(1) Rand School of Social Science, 9 East 15th Street, adjoining N.E. corner of Fifth Avenue. July 31 1929

(2) The same, from the street level. June 11, 1933

711331f-b.text:
(1) Rand School of Social Science, 9 East 15th Street, adjoining N.E. corner of Fifth Avenue. July 31 1929

711334f-a.text:
(1) 15th Street west from Fifth Avenue. At the right adjoining the N.W. corner of Fifth Avenue, is the New York hospital, which was built in 1877 and will be demolished in 1934.

June 11, 1933.

P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date and showing demolition of the former New York Hospital.

March 22, 1935.

P.L. Sperr.

708348f-a.text: Kensington Building, 73 Fifth Ave., at the N.E. corner of East 15th Street. Also shown is East 15th Street, north side, east from and including Fifth Ave., to Union Square. Note the wooden Battle Ship "that never went to Sea"; a recruiting device at the start of the World War; in Union Square. About 1917.
